(1711–1782) [ Maron. ] Titular bp. of Apamea , Scriptor in the Vatican Library, Rome; nephew of J. S. Assemani , and cousin of J. A. Assemani . Among his numerous works the most important is the two-volume Acta Sanctorum Martyrum orientalium et occidentalium (1748; FT by F. Lagrange, 1852). Besides assisting his uncle in the catalogue of the Vatican mss. he was also the compiler of a number of other catalogues of oriental mss. (notably that of the Medicean-Laurentian Library in Florence, 1742); he was also responsible for the third Syriac volume (1743) of the six-volume edition of Ephrem . Sources G. Levi Della Vida, ‘Assemani, S. E.’, in Dizionario biografico degli Italiani , vol. 4 (1962), 441–2. K.  Rizk, ‘Assémani, Étienne-Évode’, in Encyclopédie Maronite , vol. 1 (1992), 437–39. E.  Tisserant, ‘Notes pour servir à la biographie d’Étienne-Évode Assémani’, OC 29 (1932), 264–76. Sebastian P. Brock
